meanings.definition: A secret or disguised way of writing; a code.
meanings.sent1: I created a cipher to send a secret message to my friend.
meanings.sent2: The spy used a complex cipher to encrypt his top-secret information.
meanings.sent3: The detective cracked the cipher and uncovered the hidden message.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a cipher, revealing her true feelings to those who knew her well.
meanings.sent5: The ancient scroll contained a mysterious cipher that puzzled historians for years.

meanings.definition: A person or thing of no value or importance.
meanings.sent1: He felt like a cipher in the presence of the famous celebrities.
meanings.sent2: The old broken toy was considered a cipher among the valuable antiques.
meanings.sent3: The lost pen was just a cipher in the grand scheme of things.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling city, he was just a cipher in the crowd of strangers.
meanings.sent5: The forgotten book became a cipher on the dusty shelf of the library.

meanings.definition: To use mathematical symbols to encode or decode a message.
meanings.sent1: She had to cipher the encrypted message to reveal its true meaning.
meanings.sent2: The students learned how to cipher messages using complex algorithms.
meanings.sent3: He tried to cipher the math problem but got confused with the symbols.
meanings.sent4: In order to understand the ancient text, they had to cipher the coded language.
meanings.sent5: The spy needed to quickly cipher the secret code before time ran out.
